This week turned out to be a transitional one. The first orientation lectures took place, along with introductory classes in mathematics and programming.
Getting to know my group went smoothly â€” we discussed upcoming assignments and shared expectations.

Beyond studies, I joined a student IT community where peers work on projects and take part in hackathons. This is both inspiring and motivating, pushing me to improve my skills faster.

ðŸ“Œ Week from August 15 to August 21

This week was marked by organizational meetings. We received our class schedule, got acquainted with the deanâ€™s office, and learned about upcoming faculty events.

The highlight was a tour of the RUDN campus. We were shown laboratories, computer classrooms, and the library. It felt clear that many opportunities for growth lie ahead.
